plus.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: used to show that one number or amount is added to another
plus.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
plus.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: There are numerous clubs, plus a casino.
plus.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Some knowledge of Spanish is a definite plus in this job.
plus.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: used to talk about an advantage or good feature of a thing or situation
plus.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Another of the Beach Club’s plus points is that it’s right in the middle of town.
This is not an exciting car to drive, but on the plus side it is extremely reliable.
plus.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: used after a number to mean an amount which is more than that number
plus.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Most children start school when they’re five plus.
plus.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures
plus.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: He’s been studying hard for exams. Plus he’s been working in a bar at night.
plus.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: used when one amount or number is added to another
plus.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: Weekend calls cost a $1 base fee, plus $1 a minute.
His salary is £30,000 a year, plus bonuses.
plus.translation[4].definitions[1].defin: used when giving the second reason for something
plus.translation[4].definitions[1].examp: Cost-cutting, plus strong sales, enabled the company to break even.
plus.translation[4].definitions[2].defin: used to say that a number may be more or less by a certain amount
plus.translation[4].definitions[2].examp: The poll’s margin of error is plus or minus 4 percentage points.
plus.translation[5].definitions[0].defin: an advantage or good feature of something
plus.translation[5].definitions[0].examp: One of the pluses of the job is having really supportive colleagues.
A huge plus factor is the central location of the hotel.
plus.translation[6].definitions[0].examp: Some waterside apartments are selling at £250,000 plus.
the 80-plus employees of his television company
plus.translation[6].definitions[1].defin: on a stockmarket, if shares are sold on a plus tick, they are sold at a higher price than their previous one
plus.translation[6].definitions[1].examp: He traded near the close of the day on either a plus tick or a zero-plus tick  (=where the price is unchanged).
